editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Know the rules of poker? Get ready to break them in this brilliant roguelike deck-builder, which puts its own twist on the classic card game.
Solve puzzles, inspect chilling notes and videos, and outrun a nightmarish smiling cat in the third chapter of this freaky horror series.
Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp lives on! This offline version of the beloved management sim includes all the original content, plus a few new surprises.

ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

editorialNotes.standard: Ready for something a bit different? Plague Inc. challenges you to strategically spread and evolve diseases. While the concept isn't exactly honorable, the surprising ways all these novel gameplay systems interact make this twist on traditional heroism a lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

editorialNotes.standard: What happens after a zombie apocalypse? Find out by intuitively rebuilding civilization in this slick sequel to Plague Inc.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic light—it’s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstar’s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.

An intriguing genre blend, Terraria mixes collection, construction, and combat in a retro-styled 2D adventure. Break apart the world, uncovering rare treasures and digging deep underground for resources to build elaborate houses. Then craft powerful weapons and armor before facing bizarre, fantastical creatures. It’s a huge, sophisticated experience that’s easy to spend hours with—a universe of densely layered surprises, where every session is exciting.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

name: Ticket to Ride® The Board Game

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Your starship is outgunned and on the run from a fleet of rebel forces; can you make it home alive? A space-combat experience of remarkable depth, FTL's elegant, interlocking gameplay systems generate moments of remarkable tension and reward. As your vessel leapfrogs between galaxies, you’ll manage a crew, extinguish engine-room fires, target enemy shield generators with energy weapons, and equip powerful upgrades so you can plunge deeper into the uncharted cosmos. It’s a constant cycle of surprise and excitement, augmented by the game’s stylish presentation and irresistible charm.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Created by Ellen DeGeneres, this riotous game-night challenge reinvents charades for the app generation. Pick a category, then hold your device up to your head, screen facing outward, and guess the words using your friends’ clues. Several categories are included, with many more available as In-App Purchases. Best of all, you can record and share videos of your friends’ increasingly frantic efforts to clue you in. Heads Up! puts a fun, fast-paced party starter in your pocket.

Years after its debut, The Room remains one of the most absorbing puzzlers we’ve played. Use ingenuity and intuitive controls to manipulate a series of nested boxes and unlock the secret inside. As each thrown switch and decrypted code reveals another intricate enigma, breathtaking sights and eerie sounds weave an irresistible atmosphere of suspense. All the more amazing for being the debut effort from Fireproof Games, The Room beautifully blurs the line between entertainment and artistry.

When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you don’t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, it’s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We love dropping into this city builder’s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighborhoods of our own creation.

name: Smart Baby Shapes: Learning games for toddler kids

editorialNotes.standard: Mesmerizing from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.

Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. It’s an outstanding return for Disney’s most beloved mascot.
Harvest crops of olives, grapes, and sorghum for the first time in this long-running sim series that lets you really dig into the details of virtual farming.

editorialNotes.tagline: Get a job and have kids with a spin

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Enigmatic settings and storytelling enrich the mysteries of Leonardo da Vinci's gadgetry in this escape room puzzle series’ fantastic conclusion.
Control a massive arcade claw machine to grab knives, swords, and other handy items as you delve deep into this clever roguelike RPG.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains, and upgrading lines. There’s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing subways come together—and since no two games play alike, we’re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

editorialNotes.standard: Imagination becomes reality in 5th Cell’s spectacular puzzler—just write the name of almost anything in a magical notebook, and it appears before you. Expanding on the more linear Scribblenauts Remix, this game turns you loose to explore an open world. By creating everything from flying pigs to rocket launchers, you solve problems big and small for the people you meet. As the freedom to roam met the freedom to create, we got lost in coming up with the zaniest, most outlandish, or sometimes most diabolical ways to solve each scenario.
